(Yes i know i said i quit but im on occasionly and maybe a bit longer_

its the owners fault and as a german shepherd owner i don’t care what anyone else says.

I’ve also had a german shepherd cross doberman who was abused and you will not find a friendly dog towards humans. He was a lot of work but a year or so after, he’d walk home with anyone lol, absolutely loved people.

So ban inexperienced people with those types of dogs.

item.title: Rottweilers (should they be banned)
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Sometimes a dog attacks children of the dogs owners. This is because dogs do need attention, and at first they get all the attention. Then, when the owners get a child the dog gets jealous because it doesn’t get all the attention anymore. So it tries to eliminate it’s competetor, wich is normal IMO.

Read full topic

item.title: Rottweilers (should they be banned)
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

This is complete BULLSHIT. When I used to live in haigh, the people who ran the local fish and chip shop had two rottweilers, the female who had had the dogs from around 7 weeks could do anything, she could make them play dead, she could put her hands and such inside their mouths and the dogs would just sit down, so basically steriotyping a dog because of the bad reputation by some accidents recently is utter bullshit.

[quote=“Niall, post:11, topic:173322”]

That should be banned. Trust me, fucking completely horrible dogs. A few friends of mine have rottweiliers, completely harmless, however a few months back, I was living in a flat and the people above us had 2 american bulldogs, fucking horrible.

However, rottweilers that have been trained properly, won’t be savage. You can’t blame a dog for it’s unexperienced owners mistake.[/quote]

Since I was a baby my parents have had like 3 American bulldogs, and not ONE of them have been violent towards anything for no reason, one of the dogs attacked another on the grounds it went for my mother but that’s it, none have had to be put down because of voilent behaviour, they all died of natural causes.

Read full topic

item.title: Rottweilers (should they be banned)
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Chimaera God:

I have two French Mastives, one of them around 120 pounds, and the other weighing in around 200, which happens to be the male. Both of tham are the biggest babies in the world. Dogs shouldn’t be banned, mainly becausethey’re frigiin’ awesome. Yeah, there are some assholes who raise their dogs to be kiling machines, but that shouldn’t affect people who have dogs that are babies like mine :D.

My friend had a French mastiff, best fucking dog ever. This dog could easily kill me at the ages of around 2 years old, since it was physically stronger than me. But it was the friendliest dog ever. It hated being alone, but like all dogs they love to play and a dog that size it was hard to know when it was playing. But anyway, it died at 3 years old because of some growth in his stomach :(.

Read full topic

item.title: Rottweilers (should they be banned)
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

My lab is the nicest in the world, honestly has never done anything bad. But if you piss her off while eating, she could rip your fucking head off.

[quote=“BlackThursday, post:26, topic:173322”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=233603.msg1997309#msg1997309 date=1200376327]
What about people that have been hit by cars? Should they reconsider if cars should be banned?

No. ANY breed of dogs can grow up to be killers (except for poodles maybe), and it’s all about how they are brought up. If they’re trained to be killers, they will be. Training dogs to be killers should be frowned upon, not just an entire breed of dogs.
[/quote]

Some one gets it. Thanks for the open mind.[/quote]
Agreed. Nice comparison.

Read full topic

item.title: Rottweilers (should they be banned)
item.dc:creator: @BlackThursday BlackThursday
item.description:
@BlackThursday wrote:

[quote=“Sick of Air, post:22, topic:173322”][quote author=BlackThursday link=topic=233603.msg1997268#msg1997268 date=1200375530]
People need to reconsider pittbulls.
[/quote]
What about the people that have been attacked by them? You saying that they should reconsider the thing that attacked them to be a cute and cuddly puppy?[/quote]

No I’m saying that just because a dog is a pittbull doesn’t mean it’s a bloodthirsty killing machine.

If the owner is irresponsible than the dog can turn out nasty. But if your a good owner, you shouldn’t have a problem.
